intro: Lipochaeta venosa, commonly known as the slender lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the warmer months. Lipochaeta venosa is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy species in its native habitat.
